intro: Redfieldia hitchcockii f. aristata, commonly known as the aristate redfieldia, is a rare and distinctive member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate, lacey appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to specific regions in the western United States, particularly in arid and rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
